text.english: Teorema: \(\texttt{exp}\) is correct (\(\texttt{exp}\) of two \(\mathcal{N}Term\) is equivalent to the exponentation of the corresponding corrispondent numerical values of the two \(\mathcal{N}Term\)), i.e. \[ \forall n,m \in \mathcal{N}Term . \; \texttt{val}(\texttt{exp}(n,m)) = \texttt{val}(m) ^ {\texttt{val}(n)} \]
text.italiano: Teorema: \(\texttt{exp}\) Ã¨ corretta (\(\texttt{exp}\) di due \(\mathcal{N}Term\) equivale all'esponenziazione dei corrispondenti valori numerici dei due \(\mathcal{N}Term\)), i.e. \[ \forall n,m \in \mathcal{N}Term . \; \texttt{val}(\texttt{exp}(n,m)) = \texttt{val}(m) ^ {\texttt{val}(n)} \]

theorem.coq: Theorem val_exp: forall n m : nterm , val (exp n m) = val m ^ val n.
